intro: Laggera arida, commonly known as desert laggera, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Laggera arida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
